speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
There’s
               
              not
               
              a
               
              man
               
              I
               
              meet
               
              but
               
              doth
               
              salute
               
              me

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
As
               
              if
               
              I
               
              were
               
              their
               
              well-acquainted
               
              friend
              ,

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
And
               
              everyone
               
              doth
               
              call
               
              me
               
              by
               
              my
               
              name
              .

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Some
               
              tender
               
              money
               
              to
               
              me
              ;
               
              some
               
              invite
               
              me
              ;

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Some
               
              other
               
              give
               
              me
               
              thanks
               
              for
               
              kindnesses
              ;

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Some
               
              offer
               
              me
               
              commodities
               
              to
               
              buy
              .

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Even
               
              now
               
              a
               
              tailor
               
              called
               
              me
               
              in
               
              his
               
              shop

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
And
               
              showed
               
              me
               
              silks
               
              that
               
              he
               
              had
               
              bought
               
              for
               
              me
              ,

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
And
               
              therewithal
               
              took
               
              measure
               
              of
               
              my
               
              body
              .

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Sure
               
              these
               
              are
               
              but
               
              imaginary
               
              wiles
              ,

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
And
               
              Lapland
               
              sorcerers
               
              inhabit
               
              here
              .

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Master, here’s the gold you sent

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: me for. What, have you got the picture of old Adam

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: new-appareled?

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
What
               
              gold
               
              is
               
              this
              ?
               
              What
               
              Adam
               
              dost
               
              thou
               
              mean
              ?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Not that Adam that kept the

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Paradise, but that Adam that keeps the prison; he

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: that goes in the calf’s skin that was killed for the

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Prodigal; he that came behind you, sir, like an evil

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: angel, and bid you forsake your liberty.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: I understand thee not.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: No? Why, ’tis a plain case: he

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: that went like a bass viol in a case of leather; the

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: man, sir, that, when gentlemen are tired, gives

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: them a sob and ’rests them; he, sir, that takes pity

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: on decayed men and gives them suits of durance; he

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: that sets up his rest to do more exploits with his

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: mace than a morris-pike.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: What, thou mean’st an

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: officer?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Ay, sir, the sergeant of the band;

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: he that brings any man to answer it that breaks his

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: band; one that thinks a man always going to bed

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: and says “God give you good rest.”

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Well, sir, there rest in your

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: foolery. Is there any ships puts forth tonight? May

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: we be gone?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Why, sir, I brought you word an

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: hour since that the bark “Expedition” put forth tonight,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: and then were you hindered by the sergeant

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: to tarry for the hoy “Delay”. Here are the angels that

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: you sent for to deliver you.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
The
               
              fellow
               
              is
               
              distract
              ,
               
              and
               
              so
               
              am
               
              I
              ,

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
And
               
              here
               
              we
               
              wander
               
              in
               
              illusions
              .

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Some
               
              blessèd
               
              power
               
              deliver
               
              us
               
              from
               
              hence
              !

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Well
               
              met
              ,
               
              well
               
              met
              ,
               
              Master
               
              Antipholus
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
I
               
              see
              ,
               
              sir
              ,
               
              you
               
              have
               
              found
               
              the
               
              goldsmith
               
              now
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Is
               
              that
               
              the
               
              chain
               
              you
               
              promised
               
              me
               
              today
              ?

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Satan
              ,
               
              avoid
              !
               
              I
               
              charge
               
              thee
              ,
               
              tempt
               
              me
               
              not
              .

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Master
              ,
               
              is
               
              this
               
              Mistress
               
              Satan
              ?

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
It
               
              is
               
              the
               
              devil
              .

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Nay, she is worse; she is the

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: devil’s dam, and here she comes in the habit of a

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: light wench. And thereof comes that the wenches

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: say “God damn me”; that’s as much to say “God

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: make me a light wench.” It is written they appear

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: to men like angels of light. Light is an effect of fire,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: and fire will burn: ergo, light wenches will burn.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Come not near her.

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Your
               
              man
               
              and
               
              you
               
              are
               
              marvelous
               
              merry
              ,
               
              sir
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Will
               
              you
               
              go
               
              with
               
              me
              ?
               
              We’ll
               
              mend
               
              our
               
              dinner
               
              here
              .

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Master, if you do, expect spoon

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: meat, or bespeak a long spoon.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Why, Dromio?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Marry, he must have a long

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: spoon that must eat with the devil.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Avoid
               
              then
              ,
               
              fiend
              !
               
              What
               
              tell’st
               
              thou
               
              me
               
              of
               
              supping
              ?

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Thou
               
              art
              ,
               
              as
               
              you
               
              are
               
              all
              ,
               
              a
               
              sorceress
              .

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
I
               
              conjure
               
              thee
               
              to
               
              leave
               
              me
               
              and
               
              be
               
              gone
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Give
               
              me
               
              the
               
              ring
               
              of
               
              mine
               
              you
               
              had
               
              at
               
              dinner

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Or
              ,
               
              for
               
              my
               
              diamond
              ,
               
              the
               
              chain
               
              you
               
              promised
              ,

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
And
               
              I’ll
               
              be
               
              gone
              ,
               
              sir
              ,
               
              and
               
              not
               
              trouble
               
              you
              .

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Some devils ask but the parings

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: of one’s nail, a rush, a hair, a drop of blood, a pin, a

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: nut, a cherrystone; but she, more covetous, would

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: have a chain. Master, be wise. An if you give it her,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: the devil will shake her chain and fright us with it.

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
I
               
              pray
               
              you
              ,
               
              sir
              ,
               
              my
               
              ring
               
              or
               
              else
               
              the
               
              chain
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
I
               
              hope
               
              you
               
              do
               
              not
               
              mean
               
              to
               
              cheat
               
              me
               
              so
              .

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Avaunt
              ,
               
              thou
               
              witch
              !
              —
              Come
              ,
               
              Dromio
              ,
               
              let
               
              us
               
              go
              .

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
“
              Fly
               
              pride
              ,
              ”
               
              says
               
              the
               
              peacock
              .

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Mistress
              ,
               
              that
               
              you
               
              know
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Now
              ,
               
              out
               
              of
               
              doubt
               
              Antipholus
               
              is
               
              mad
              ;

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Else
               
              would
               
              he
               
              never
               
              so
               
              demean
               
              himself
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
A
               
              ring
               
              he
               
              hath
               
              of
               
              mine
               
              worth
               
              forty
               
              ducats
              ,

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
And
               
              for
               
              the
               
              same
               
              he
               
              promised
               
              me
               
              a
               
              chain
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Both
               
              one
               
              and
               
              other
               
              he
               
              denies
               
              me
               
              now
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
The
               
              reason
               
              that
               
              I
               
              gather
               
              he
               
              is
               
              mad
              ,

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Besides
               
              this
               
              present
               
              instance
               
              of
               
              his
               
              rage
              ,

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Is
               
              a
               
              mad
               
              tale
               
              he
               
              told
               
              today
               
              at
               
              dinner

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Of
               
              his
               
              own
               
              doors
               
              being
               
              shut
               
              against
               
              his
               
              entrance
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
Belike
               
              his
               
              wife
              ,
               
              acquainted
               
              with
               
              his
               
              fits
              ,

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
On
               
              purpose
               
              shut
               
              the
               
              doors
               
              against
               
              his
               
              way
              .

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
My
               
              way
               
              is
               
              now
               
              to
               
              hie
               
              home
               
              to
               
              his
               
              house

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
And
               
              tell
               
              his
               
              wife
               
              that
              ,
               
              being
               
              lunatic
              ,

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
He
               
              rushed
               
              into
               
              my
               
              house
               
              and
               
              took
               
              perforce

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
My
               
              ring
               
              away
              .
               
              This
               
              course
               
              I
               
              fittest
               
              choose
              ,

speaker: COURTESAN
text:
For
               
              forty
               
              ducats
               
              is
               
              too
               
              much
               
              to
               
              lose
              .
